page.title: 02THE LIFE OF THE FARM MANAGER
page.content: I am David Baker manager of the farm on Werrington Park Estate.It comprises 862 acres of which 100 are for cereal, 15-20 are for rape,20 for maize and the remainder for silage and grazing. My day begins around 7.00am.,when I organise my 7 staff for their duties.I then help to check all the stock which consists of 400 ewes,1100 store lambs to fatten and 70 beef, reared and sold as stores (Â£700-Â£800 per head).Then I attend to office duties and see the dairymen who milk the 240 cows in a new dairy complex built over the past 5 years.As I am a working manager I am on call for any emergency arising during the day and meals are taken at appropriate times.In Autumn,due to harvest and new born calves,my working day is longer.I now'sponge'the sheep this brings them into heat, and after serving they lamb at the same time.
